com.almasb.fxgl.time

Enum TimerManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<TimerManager>
      • com.almasb.fxgl.time.TimerManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WorldStateListener, Serializable, Comparable<TimerManager>

    public enum TimerManager
extends Enum<TimerManager>
implements WorldStateListener
    Contains convenience methods and manages timer based actions. Computes time taken by each frame. Keeps track of tick and global time.
    Author:
    Almas Baimagambetov (AlmasB) (almaslvl@gmail.com)

      • tickProperty

        public javafx.beans.property.ReadOnlyLongProperty tickProperty()
        Returns:
        tick

      • getTick

        public long getTick()
        Returns current tick (frame). When the game has just started, the first cycle in the loop will have tick == 1, second cycle - 2 and so on.

        The update to this number happens when a new update cycle starts.

        Returns:
        current tick

      • resetTicks

        public void resetTicks()
        Resets current tick to 0.

      • getNow

        public long getNow()
        Current time for this tick in nanoseconds. Also time elapsed from the start of game. This time does not change while the game is paused. This time does not change while within the same tick.
        Returns:
        current time in nanoseconds

      • getFPS

        public int getFPS()
        Returns:
        average render FPS

      • fpsProperty

        public javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty fpsProperty()
        Returns:
        average render FPS property

      • getPerformanceFPS

        public int getPerformanceFPS()
        Returns:
        Average performance FPS

      • performanceFPSProperty

        public javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty performanceFPSProperty()
        Returns:
        Average performance FPS property

      • tickStart

        public void tickStart(long internalTime)
        Called at the start of a game update tick. This is where tick becomes tick + 1.
        Parameters:
        internalTime - internal JavaFX time

      • tickEnd

        public void tickEnd()
        Called at the end of a game update tick.

      • runAtInterval

        public void runAtInterval(Runnable action,
                          javafx.util.Duration interval)
        The Runnable action will be scheduled to run at given interval. The action will run for the first time after given interval.

        Note: the scheduled action will not run while the game is paused.

        Parameters:
        action - the action
        interval - time

      • runAtIntervalWhile

        public void runAtIntervalWhile(Runnable action,
                               javafx.util.Duration interval,
                               javafx.beans.property.ReadOnlyBooleanProperty whileCondition)
        The Runnable action will be scheduled for execution iff whileCondition is initially true. If that's the case then the Runnable action will be scheduled to run at given interval. The action will run for the first time after given interval

        The action will be removed from schedule when whileCondition becomes false.

        Note: the scheduled action will not run while the game is paused

        Parameters:
        action - action to execute
        interval - interval between executions
        whileCondition - condition

      • runOnceAfter

        public void runOnceAfter(Runnable action,
                         javafx.util.Duration delay)
        The Runnable action will be executed once after given delay

        Note: the scheduled action will not run while the game is paused

        Parameters:
        action - action to execute
        delay - delay after which to execute

      • clearActions

        public void clearActions()
        Clears all registered timer based actions.
